title: Package installed as a dependency whereas it was already installed with same spec

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I installed a package manually:

```shell
$ spack install harfbuzz@2.6.8%gcc@9.3.0~graphite2
[+] /home/cessenat/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-skylake/gcc-9.3.0/harfbuzz-2.6.8-tdt4zlgepzzjcxafwzcb2hqxuvdhbitp
and I checked the spec:
$ spack spec harfbuzz %gcc@9.3.0 | grep harfbuzz
harfbuzz%gcc@9.3.0
harfbuzz@2.6.8%gcc@9.3.0~graphite2 arch=linux-centos7-skylake

Then, I installed qgis with
$ spack install --jobs 1 qgis %gcc@9.3.0
==> Installing harfbuzz-2.6.8-6fdhejlubxsxc52zz4wcuzpssioljkkd
where we can see that it as though harfbuzz were not installed.

Specs provide the same output as for the explicitely installed package:
$ spack spec qgis %gcc@9.3.0 | grep harfbuzz
            ^harfbuzz@2.6.8%gcc@9.3.0~graphite2 arch=linux-centos7-skylake
```

There probably is something I mis-understood from the documentation, it might be trivial for an expert.

spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-1080-0b58499
* **Python:** 3.8.7
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
